headline.main: A Place for Yoga in the Great Smoky Mountains of Tennessee

docs.snippet: A hidden gem of a resort, known for its delicious food and mountainous views, now has a health and wellness spa....

headline.print_headline: Hungarian, Italian Works Win Translation Prize
headline.main: Hungarian, Italian Works Win Translation Prize

docs.snippet: A Hungarian novel about art and creativity across space and time and a collection of surreal Italian poems have won prizes for best translated books....
docs.lead_paragraph: A Hungarian novel about art and creativity across space and time and a collection of surreal Italian poems have won prizes for best translated books.

docs.snippet: Five suspected drug cartel supporters were killed in a shootout with vigilantes fighting the Knights Templar cartel in western Mexico, authorities reported Monday, the same day the federal government announced the beginning of "demobilization" for...
docs.lead_paragraph: Five suspected drug cartel supporters were killed in a shootout with vigilantes fighting the Knights Templar cartel in western Mexico, authorities reported Monday, the same day the federal government announced the beginning of "demobilization" for the vigilantes' "self-defense" movement.

headline.main: Iraq's Ailing President Talabani Is Shown Casting a Vote

docs.snippet: Video of the ailing president of Iraq, Jalal Talabani, surfaced just as some voting got underway for the first parliamentary elections since the United States withdrawal in 2011....
docs.abstract: Video of the ailing president of Iraq, Jalal Talabani, surfaced just as some voting got underway for the first parliamentary elections since the United States withdrawal in 2011.

headline.print_headline: Suicide Bomber Kills 30 at Kurdish Rally in Eastern Iraq
headline.main: Suicide Bomber Kills 30 at Kurdish Rally in Eastern Iraq

docs.snippet: A suicide attacker killed at least 30 people and wounded 50 others at a Kurdish political gathering on Monday, in the town of Khanaqin, 140 km (100 miles) northeast of Baghdad, security sources said....
docs.lead_paragraph: A suicide attacker killed at least 30 people and wounded 50 others at a Kurdish political gathering on Monday, in the town of Khanaqin, 140 km (100 miles) northeast of Baghdad, security sources said.

headline.print_headline: Busch Driving No. 26 Suretone Honda in Indy 500
headline.main: Busch Driving No. 26 Suretone Honda in Indy 500

docs.snippet: Kurt Busch will drive the No. 26 Suretone Honda for Andretti Autosport in his attempt to run the Indianapolis 500 and NASCAR's 600-mile race on the same day....
docs.lead_paragraph: Kurt Busch will drive the No. 26 Suretone Honda for Andretti Autosport in his attempt to run the Indianapolis 500 and NASCAR's 600-mile race on the same day.

headline.print_headline: Toyota Moving US Base From California to Texas
headline.main: Toyota Moving US Base From California to Texas

docs.snippet: Toyota delivered a surprise pink slip to California on Monday, announcing the company would move its U.S. headquarters and about 3,000 jobs from the Los Angeles suburbs to the outskirts of Dallas....
docs.lead_paragraph: Toyota delivered a surprise pink slip to California on Monday, announcing the company would move its U.S. headquarters and about 3,000 jobs from the Los Angeles suburbs to the outskirts of Dallas.

headline.print_headline: Antarctic Prime Spot for Tuesday's Solar Eclipse
headline.main: Antarctic Prime Spot for Tuesday's Solar Eclipse

docs.snippet: Earthlings get their first solar eclipse of the year Tuesday. But you have to be well south of the equator to see it....
docs.lead_paragraph: Earthlings get their first solar eclipse of the year Tuesday. But you have to be well south of the equator to see it.

headline.print_headline: UN Chief Demands Release of Observers in Ukraine
headline.main: UN Chief Demands Release of Observers in Ukraine

docs.snippet: Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon is strongly condemning the capture of military observers in Ukraine and is demanding their immediate release "unconditionally and unharmed."...
docs.lead_paragraph: Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon is strongly condemning the capture of military observers in Ukraine and is demanding their immediate release "unconditionally and unharmed."
